content.en: Preeclampsia prediction: Researchers are evaluating and testing algorithms for predicting preeclampsia, a potentially dangerous condition during pregnancy. The algorithms being studied include the Fetal Medicine Foundation (FMF) algorithm, the Gaussian model algorithm, and guidelines from organizations like the National Institute for Health and Clinical Excellence (NICE) and the American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists (ACOG). These algorithms aim to improve the accuracy of screening and prediction for preeclampsia, allowing for early intervention and better management of the condition.
content.da: Præeklampsi forudsigelse: Forskere evaluerer og tester algoritmer til forudsigelse af præeklampsi, en potentielt farlig tilstand under graviditeten. De algoritmer, der undersøges, inkluderer Fetal Medicine Foundation (FMF) algoritmen, den Gaussiske modelalgoritme og retningslinjer fra organisationer som National Institute for Health and Clinical Excellence (NICE) og American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists (ACOG). Disse algoritmer har til formål at forbedre nøjagtigheden af screening og forudsigelse af præeklampsi, hvilket muliggør tidlig intervention og bedre håndtering af tilstanden.
